title: 00165 no fan spin
message:
820-00165 has no liquid no signs of damage.

ppbus - 8.6v
pp3v42 - 3.42v
SMC_RESET_L  - 3.4v
pp3v3_sus - 3.3v

title: 00165 no fan spin
message:
No pulse at 5V coil when you connect the charger?

Trigger SMC_ONOFF_L and check for drop pulse at PM_PWRBTN_L.

title: 00165 no fan spin
message:
No pulse at 5V coil when you connect the charger?  - i get a pulse when first pluging in 5v.  after .01v

Trigger SMC_ONOFF_L and check for drop pulse at PM_PWRBTN_L.  - yes drop is in voltage

title: 00165 no fan spin
message: Then check for pulse at PM_SLP_S4/3_L at same time.

title: 00165 no fan spin
message: they both are pulsing when first plugged in. i think they are going to 3.3v

title: 00165 no fan spin
message:
Triggering SMC_ONOFF_L various times, is easy to catch the pulse, if exists.
In such case, all S3 and S0 voltages must pulse too.
Check for pulse at all big coils, including VCORE.
Also check at pins 7 & 3 of U1950.
Try to start in SMC bypass mode too.

title: 00165 no fan spin
message: I tired starting in smc bypass and i got fanspin.  but then almost right after something started smoking.  i can't find what burned on the board.

title: 00165 no fan spin
message:
Some SMC sensor stops it to start in normal mode.
Now check what got burnt.
Check all secondary power supplies, and pages 57/58.

title: 00165 no fan spin
message:
r7006 had a hole in it and was expanded. i replaced it.
page 57 is - Misc Power Supplies
page 58 is - Power FETs

title: 00165 no fan spin
message:
Post diode mode to ground at C7090/98.
D7005 can be bad too.

title: 00165 no fan spin
message:
diode mode c7090 - .387
c7098 - .322
d7005 tested against known good and reading are same.

title: 00165 no fan spin
message:
do i have the right pages that you wanted me to test
page 57 is - Misc Power Supplies
page 58 is - Power FETs

title: 00165 no fan spin
message:
l7320 - 1.8 pulse
l7310- 1.8 pulse
l7630 - 1v pulse
l7430 - 1.2v pulse
l7560 - 3.3v stable
l7130 - 8.6v stable
l3095 - 0v no pulse
l7701 - 0v no pulse

i'm getting a pulse fan spin on smc bypass now

title: 00165 no fan spin
message:
Do you get a pulse only, or cycling?
Check for pulse at PLT_RESET_L.

title: 00165 no fan spin
message:
if i do smc bypass i get pulse of fanspin

i get pulse on  PLT_RESET_L   a little over 1v

title: 00165 no fan spin
message:
Did you check for short after Power MOSFETs?
Output voltages pulsing there too?

Try known good BIOS, just in case.
